author: Staff Reporter
text:
Enumeration of persons involved in occupations that entails dealing with human waste commenced here under the Dharmapuri municipality on Monday.

The three-day enumeration undertaken under the aegis of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment seeks to take into account those left out in the earlier census of manual scavengers and those involved in sanitation works that bring them in contact with human waste are being brought into the present enumeration. The census will be held till February 24.

The objective of the enumeration is to rehabilitate persons involved in the sanitation of public toilets, open canals, septic tanks, railway tracks and other spaces that have sites are open defecation.

According to the Municipality, the enumeration will be carried out through a “self-declaration form” where information will be elicited from the conservancy workers. Further, households that have insanitary latrines/open sewers that provide conditions that compel conservancy workers to deal with human faeces are advised to upgrade their toilets to sanitary toilets within the Municipality-framed time.

This is the re-enumeration process that is slated to account for persons left out in the earlier enumeration. Further details may be ascertained over commr.dharmapuri@tn.gov.in or on phone 04342-260910.
title: Manual scavenging: enumeration commences in Dharmapuri
